com.sagar.lockpattern_gridview

Interface PatternInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PatternGridView

    public interface PatternInterface
    Created by aravind on 20/9/14. An interface which specifies the functionality which will be available in PatternGridView

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  PatternInterface.PatternListener
      Interface to be implemented, to receive callbacks for pattern events.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearPattern()
      Clear the pattern; the path will be reset if this function is called
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPattern()
      Get the last pattern entered in the View.
      int getPatternType()
      Returns the patternType.
      boolean isInputEnabled()
      Returns whether touch input is enabled for the view
      void setInputEnabled(boolean mIsInputEnabled)
      Sets whether the view should process or ignore the touches
      void setPatternListener(PatternInterface.PatternListener listener)
      Set the callbacks for different events such as PatternGridView.PatternState.IN_PROGRESS, PatternGridView.PatternState.ENTERED, PatternGridView.PatternState.BLANK
      void setPatternType(int mPatternType)
      Set the current pattern type.
      void setRingColor(int color)
      Sets the color of the ring around the dots in the path entered.

    • Method Detail

      • clearPattern

        void clearPattern()
        Clear the pattern; the path will be reset if this function is called

      • getPattern

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPattern()
        Get the last pattern entered in the View.
        Returns:
        the last pattern; It is returned as an ordered list of numbers, each number represents a particular cell in the pattern grid

      • setRingColor

        void setRingColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the ring around the dots in the path entered. This color is applied only when the pattern has been set. While the user is still drawing, the color shown will depend upon the theme set in the layout xml file or using setPatternType(int) This color is also applied to the indicator arrows whenever it is applied to the rings
        Parameters:
        color - The color to be set

      • setPatternListener

        void setPatternListener(PatternInterface.PatternListener listener)
        Set the callbacks for different events such as PatternGridView.PatternState.IN_PROGRESS, PatternGridView.PatternState.ENTERED, PatternGridView.PatternState.BLANK
        Parameters:
        listener - An instance of a class which implements PatternInterface.PatternListener

      • isInputEnabled

        boolean isInputEnabled()
        Returns whether touch input is enabled for the view
        Returns:
        true, if the view is accepting touches, false, if the view is ignoring them

      • setInputEnabled

        void setInputEnabled(boolean mIsInputEnabled)
        Sets whether the view should process or ignore the touches
        Parameters:
        mIsInputEnabled - value to be set

      • getPatternType

        int getPatternType()
        Returns the patternType. Pattern type is basically a "theme" for the view. 2 types are supported as of now, PatternGridView.PATTERN_TYPE_CHECK, which is suitable to be used over a dark background, and PatternGridView.PATTERN_TYPE_STORE, which is suitable to be drawn over a light background.

        The names come from the colors used in setting and getting pattern in Android L(preview) ;)

        Returns:
        the current pattern type

      • setPatternType

        void setPatternType(int mPatternType)
        Set the current pattern type. Pattern type is basically a "theme" for the view. 2 types are supported as of now, PatternGridView.PATTERN_TYPE_CHECK, which is suitable to be used over a dark background, and PatternGridView.PATTERN_TYPE_STORE, which is suitable to be drawn over a light background.

        The names come from the colors used in setting and getting pattern in Android L(preview) ;)

        Parameters:
        mPatternType - new type to be set.
